title: How to Open .Zip Files and Folders on Mac

steps.title: Find the .zip archive file in the Finder.
steps.content: Find the .zip archive file in the Finder. Open up your Finder and locate the .zip archive file that you’ve downloaded. It should be named something like “Archive.zip.” [1] X Research source

steps.title: Double click the .zip archive.
steps.content: Double click the .zip archive. This will start the unzipping process. [2] X Expert Source Luigi Oppido Computer & Tech Specialist Expert Interview. 31 July 2019. [3] X Research source If you want to unzip multiple folders, shift-click to highlight all of the folders.

steps.title: Click on the contents of the .zip archive to open them up.
steps.content: Click on the contents of the .zip archive to open them up. The unzipped folder should be in the same spot that you found the Archive.zip folder. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Open Spotlight Search.
steps.content: Open Spotlight Search. Click on the magnifying glass on the top right corner. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Drag the .zip file to your desktop.
steps.content: Drag the .zip file to your desktop. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Type in "Terminal" and open the application.
steps.content: Type in "Terminal" and open the application. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Type in "cd desktop" and click Enter.
steps.content: Type in "cd desktop" and click Enter.

steps.title: Type in "unzip file name" and click enter again.
steps.content: Type in "unzip file name " and click enter again. Where the template say file name , type the full file name including the .zip. [8] X Research source For example, if the file is titled "file.zip", type in cd desktop , click enter, type in unzip file.zip and click enter again.

steps.title: Open the new unzipped file.
steps.content: Open the new unzipped file. You can double click on it to open up the contents. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Download a third-party extension.
steps.content: Download a third-party extension. You can do a quick Google search to find free downloads of third-party extensions to use. On Mac, there are a few to choose from, including: [10] X Research source The Unarchiver WinZip (Mac Edition) [11] X Expert Source Luigi Oppido Computer & Tech Specialist Expert Interview. 31 July 2019. Keka Better Zip 4

steps.title: Find your Archive.zip file.
steps.content: Find your Archive.zip file. It should be in your Mac Finder where you downloaded it. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Click File, then Get info menu.
steps.content: Click File , then Get info menu . This will open up a drop down box where you can choose from a few different options. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Scroll to Open, then select your third-party extension.
steps.content: Scroll to Open , then select your third-party extension. If you’ve downloaded it onto your computer, you should be able to use it right away. [14] X Research source If the third-party extension isn’t showing up, try restarting your computer.

steps.title: Select “Change all.”
steps.content: Select “Change all.” This will start the process of unzipping your files. Your unzipped content will show up in the same spot as your Archive.zip folder. [15] X Research source
